channel.title: Playgrounds on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Playgrounds on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: How to make a MOC
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This memo explains how to create a Map of Content (MOC) for our knowledge hubs. The concept was introduced by Nick Milo, who also runs courses on Linking Your Thinking.

item.title: Dwarves x SP Group WALA
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’ve always wanted to visit SP Group, one of our partners, but the pandemic made it impossible until now. This year, the opportunity finally came when we decided to attend Echelon X in Singapore.

item.title: How I came up with our Security Standard
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In this memo, I want to share with you my thought process behind our security guideline for Dwarves. This is a critical aspect for a software company that aims to establish trusted partnerships with clients.

item.title: Tech Canvas
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This is where we share our journey in the ever-evolving landscape of technology. It’s a space where we unveil our latest breakthroughs, discuss our research, and delve into our innovative projects.

item.title: Recapping A publication
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Recapping a publication is the work of summarizing its key points, analyzing why it matters, and providing insights or opinions on its content.

item.title: Life cycle of a publication
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Following the core theme of MMA (Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy), every piece of content we put out requires a strategic approach, so it can cut through the noise, serve purposes and meanings to readers.

item.title: Data Pipeline Design Framework
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Motivation of Designing Data Pipeline Framework To improve and strongly go-live the data pipeline, besides apply best practices and pillar for Data Pipeline Native Solution, a design framework and pattern are robustly help us in:

item.title: Quick Learning Vector Database
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Motivation of Vector Database The motivation of this thoughts that trying to discover the LLMs and Generative AI In order to create or build, train any models there are multiple factors will need to be considered: lakes of data, metadata, data management, infrastructure, etc.

item.title: How To Take Better Screenshots On Mac
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I grab screenshots pretty often. Although macOS’s native screenshot tool is decent for most cases, it’s still a very basic one.

item.title: Google Data Fusion
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Google Data Fusion is a fully managed, cloud-native data integration service that enables users to efficiently build and manage ETL/ELT data pipelines.

item.title: Google Dataproc
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Google Dataproc is a fast and easy-to-use, fully managed cloud service for running Apache Spark and Hadoop workloads. It allows users to process and analyze large-scale data efficiently and at scale.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: User experience (UX) research is the foundation of any successful digital product or service. UX research helps companies understand their users, their needs, and their pain points.

item.title: MapReduce
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is MapReduce? Let’s start with an example. We are the head of census bureau for the state of California and tasked with finding the finding the population of all cities in California.

item.title: An Overview Of Micro Investment In Real Estate
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: How is the real estate market moving? When an industry begins this journey of digital transformation depends largely on the specific nature of its offering.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Contributing to the Brainery We’d love to accept your contributions to the project. There are just a few small guidelines you need to follow before submitting a note.
